thread.title: Sage Hospitality inks deal to operate top Chicago hotel
thread.title_full: Sage Hospitality inks deal to operate top Chicago hotel

author: Ed Sealover
title: Sage Hospitality inks deal to operate top Chicago hotel
text:
Courtesy of Sage Hospitality Sage Hospitality acquired the contract to operate the Ritz-Carlton Chicago beginning on… more Sage Hospitality has won a contract to run and renovate one of Chicago’s top hotels. The Denver-based hotel development and management company signed an agreement with JMB Realty to operate the Ritz-Carlton Chicago, located at Water Tower Place. As part of the contract, it will lead a two-year renovation of the property encompassing its guest rooms, spa and meeting space. This latest deal for Sage, which operates about 65 properties locally and nationally, continues its push into the luxury hotel sector. The company opened The Crawford Hotel at Denver Union Station last summer and acquired the contract to re-brand and operate the Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia in June. In addition to getting a makeover, the Ritz-Carlton Chicago will become a full participant in the Ritz-Carlton hotel system for the first time in 40 years. Since its 1975 opening, it’s operated under a license agreement with a predecessor of the Ritz-Carlton Hotel Co. but has not been integrated completely into the company’s systems. Until now the Chicago property has been managed by Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts, and was branded as "The Ritz-Carlton Chicago (A Four Seasons Hotel)." “We have looked forward to this deal for a very long time,” Sage President and CEO Walter Isenberg said Tuesday. “It’s one of the truly great hotels in one of the great American cities.”
